program: Master of Science in Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences (Research-focused)

toefl.notes: Minimum score of 90 is required, but average scores for admitted students are often 100+.

gre.notes: GRE is not required for the MS/PhD and MS-only applications in EECS.

description_for_vector_db: [Program Nature] Berkeley's MS in EECS is a small, highly selective research-oriented program. It is often a stepping stone to a PhD, though it can be taken as a terminal degree. [Research Excellence] Students work in prestigious labs like BAIR (Berkeley AI Research) or the RISELab. The program is world-renowned for Systems, AI, and Theory. [Silicon Valley Synergy] Located next to the tech hub, Berkeley has deep ties with startups and giants alike. [Admission Insight] High emphasis on previous research publications and technical leadership. The committee looks for 'pioneers' who can push the boundaries of CS.
